The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually linear and arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps reduce water loss. Thesium pumilum is often found in coastal areas and is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
